website_summaries.verdict: This large umbrella comes with some useful features and is hunter-friendly despite a few known issues.
pros: Hub-style design provides versatile setup for hands-free use, and the 54-inch size offers decent coverage
Convenient carry case is great for transport and storage
cons: Setup can take some time and is a bit challenging
Some owners complain about the umbrella springing leaks

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I have a tree stand with no roof. I wanted an umbrella to help keep me dry (or at least drier) while hunting in the rain. This umbrella was a pain to keep attached to the tree. It was constantly falling over to one side, even when it wasn't windy. And then the rain came. I got soaked because the umbrella leaked all along the stitching. Definitely definitely do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Fawn Freeze

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. Made very cheaply
customer_reviews.text: Great idea Very cheaply made If you want to consider it disposable than its ok
customer_reviews.author: aubie

customer_reviews.title: A good value for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Well to tell you the truth. I have examined it but actually have not put it up. Waiting for when the leaves fall. I will use it probably December and January
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Straps are not long enough. A pain to attach to tree
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: A must have on rainy days for bow hunting.
customer_reviews.text: A must have on rainy days for bow hunting. A little tricky to set up at first but you get use to it and it keeps you dry while other hunters are leaving the woods in a light rain
customer_reviews.author: Michael Murray

customer_reviews.title: Need to seal it like a new tent
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well but had to use tent sealer on it water was coming through it
customer_reviews.author: Stephen provencher

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my husband &vhe tried to use it but it leaks. Will never buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The umbrella itself is nice but the mount design for attaching it to the ...
customer_reviews.text: The umbrella itself is nice but the mount design for attaching it to the tree is crappy and very weak.I ended up breaking it trying to get it back out of the tree
customer_reviews.author: Chad H.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: If you want something to keep you dry in the stand. You might as well take a regular umbrella with you.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Tyler Smither

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It wash what I hope it would be can dry while hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Green

customer_reviews.title: Good product and this umbrella isn't a good product!
customer_reviews.text: First time putting this umbrella up this afternoon because it's raining and the rain drips right though it! It was a waste of my money to buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Adkins

product_meta.title: Muddy Pop-Up Umbrella
product_meta.description: Big Games Pop-Up Umbrella is a 54” Wide portable roof system that can be used with most Big Game treestands and ladderstands. The hub-style design allows for quick and easy installation. Six snap on tie-down strings are included for Rock Solid stability and support. Included is one carrying bag for easy transport. Weighted at only one pound.
feature_bullets: Hub Style Design for Quick Set-up
